title: Red alert for 21 districts on severe lightning: Met Dept.
body_lines: A Red alert on thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning has been issued today for most parts of the country, the Department of Meteorology said today.
As per their report, forecast for severe lightning was issued for 21 districts

The Met department also says in its forecast that thundershowers accompanied by lightning are likely at several places in Central, Sabaragamuwa, Western and Uva provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.
Heavy showers above 100 mm can be expected at some places in these areas.
Therefore, the general public are cautioned to take necessary precautions to safeguard themselves against the squall and lightning, the Department said.

Accordingly, the 19 districts which are are named as follows: Mullaitivu, Mannar, Vavuniya, Anuradhapura, Trincomalee, Polonnaruwa, Kurunegala, Matale, Batticaloa, Kegalle, Kandy, Gampaha, Nuwara Eliya, Colombo, Badulla, Kalutara, Ratnapura, Moneragala, Galle and Matara, they said.
The Meteorology Department cautioned people not to seek shelter under trees but to stay indoors.
Also the dept. requests people to avoid loitering in open areas such as paddy fields, tea plantations, playgrounds and open water bodies during thunderstorms.
Avoid using wired telephones and disconnect electric appliances during thunderstorms and avoid travelling in open vehicles, such as bicycles, trailers hauled by tractors, boats etc.
Beware of fallen trees and power lines, the department advised. (Chaturanga Samarawickrama)
